caption:
I think this is my most unhinged recording yet. Enjoy. 

Sometimes things work until they don’t work anymore, and it’s OK to pivot and try something new. 

This was inspired by a phone call I had with a former client. Her child was clearly sending the message that she did not want to be bounced to sleep anymore, and when her mom gave her the space to fall asleep on her own, she did it without any crying whatsoever!

Maybe you have been adamantly against independent sleep, but your child is sending clear messages that they are ready for it. It’s OK to change direction.

To be fair, I have also seen children clearly sending the message that they are not ready for independent sleep, and that is OK too. 

There is no reason to struggle through something that is clearly causing more stress for your family than it is good.

If your child might be demonstrating signs that they are ready to sleep on their own, but you don’t even know how to begin doing that, send me a message or comment and we can discuss the ways we can work together!
